LineItemTitle.val: Sub Periscope, Imaging and Supt Equip Prog

Description.val:
The Submarine Periscope, Imaging and Support Equipment program provides critical electromagnetic systems to all classes of submarine platforms. Systems include Electronic Warfare systems, Imaging systems, and RADAR systems which provide navigation safety and collision avoidance, particularly in high intensity littoral operations so that surveillance and weapons systems can be effectively employed.

The approximately $27M increase from FY18 to FY19 is primarily driven by the procurement of (2) additional Low Profile Photonics Masts (LPPM) to meet tactical requirements for VIRGINIA deployments, (2) Multifunction Modular Mast (MMM) antenna improvement subsystems to increase reliability and reduce operational and maintenance costs for VIRGINIA modernizations, and the increased obligation to address obsolescence issues faced by the BPS RADAR system to ensure reliable safety of ship navigation and PATRIOT RADAR system to maintain tactical awareness in littoral operations.

IMAGING: The Submarine Periscopes and Imaging Equipment Program procures the Type 18 and Type 8 periscope upgrades; all variants of Photonics Mast (PM), including Low Profile Photonics Mast (LPPM) and Task Oriented Technology Insertion Mast (TOTIM) 360 degree imaging capability and incorporates it in the Integrated Submarine Imaging System (ISIS), and VIRGINIA Class imaging upgrades and Photonics and LPPM land based spares. Commander Naval Submarine Force (CNSF), Operations Review Group (ORG) selected the Periscope Acquisition, Tracking, and Ranging with Improved Observation Techniques (PATRIOT) Type 18 Periscope Rangefinder and the Night Owl Type 8 Infra-Red (IR) Periscope as high priority tactical control technologies to field. By OPNAV Ltr Ser. N77/3U629209, 12 June 2003, OPNAV N87 established the ISIS to rapidly field these systems and integrate existing periscope imagery systems into a single system for installation on board submarines. An ISIS capability development document (CDD) was approved 22 Dec 2011. The CDD is used to fully integrate the ISIS program of record into the submarine force's rapid insertion technology process and to incorporate Fleet-endorsed requirements such as LPPM. ISIS supports high intensity operations in the littorals, providing the submarine force with the tactical imaging systems necessary to safely and effectively employ its surveillance and weapons capabilities. The IR imaging capability improves imaging at night and in low visibility conditions. The PATRIOT Automated Range Finder provides a 360 degree search independent of the visual search, enhanced situational awareness and provides a collision avoidance capability. Tactical Imagery Technology Insertion includes the common control and displays hardware and software on all platforms regardless of imaging sensors, an integrated imaging system that provides for operator alerts, imaging enhancement tools and contact analysis tools, and a fully Submarine Warfare Federated Tactical Systems (SWFTS) integrated system providing "any display anywhere." Funding improves submarine imaging capability in the areas of: ship safety, Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance (ISR), tactical control (contact management in the littorals) to provide high quality imaging 24 hours a day, 7 days a week in all weather conditions to support submarine operations worldwide. ISIS provides for the modernization of imaging systems to improve imaging capabilities for the submarine force in support of ISR requirements. This includes the integration of new capabilities, both outboard, inboard hardware and software, into the Type 18 and Type 8 Periscopes for LOS ANGELES Class and SEAWOLF Class submarines, the Photonics Mast Variant (PMV) for SSGN, Photonics Mast upgrades to the Virginia Class AN/BVY-1 ISIS capability, LPPM and TOTIM.  

PL010 - Imaging ISIS Technical Insertions - Continuing in FY19 funding procures Imaging systems and Technical Insertion kits, Design Services Allocation (DSA) installation support, and spares to upgrade ISIS systems on LOS ANGELES, SEAWOLF, VA and OHIO Class SSGN/SSBN platforms to allow for Capability Insertion and obsolescence avoidance. FY16 and later procurements also adds funding for improved copper-fiber optic diploops and hull penetrators required to support advanced Imaging and Early Warning capabilities included in Low Profile Photonics Mast and TOTIM.

PL011 - Imaging Block Upgrades - FY19 funding continues procurement of Periscopes and Imaging Equipment reliability, capability, and maintainability upgrades, e.g., Eyepiece Box, periscope mechanical hoisting mechanism upgrades, inboard electronic processing hardware and associated Integrated Logistics Support (ILS), Robust Surveillance Program, Certification of regional repair centers for Imaging System maintenance and technical data. Variable quantities and types are bought in each fiscal year.

PL012 - Funds procure replacements in support of Special Support Equipment (SSE) for each maintenance level to ensure systems are maintained in a state of operational readiness. Equipment includes Q-Band Test Equipment, Mast Dynamic Collimator, Eyebox/Mast Test Set, and Antenna/Outer Head Simulator required due to obsolescence of existing imaging systems SSE.

PL015 - Funding is for Interim Contract Support provided by the periscope manufacturer. The majority of the funding is for Type 18 service life extension, depot repair and upgrades for all configurations of Photonics Masts including LPPM. It also funds all levels of repairs for all types of tactical submarine imaging systems.

PL016 - Funding is for imaging systems training requirements to include curriculum development, training materials, and initial factory training pilot course conduct, Navy Training Plans, and instructor advisory services.

PL025 - Funding is for the procurement, support and technical insertion of VIRGINIA Class low profile imaging masts (including LPPM and TOTIM) production modules and land based spare masts and associated components. The spares will be used for replacement Imaging Masts on VIRGINIA Class Submarines. Quantity of spares will increase with VIRGINIA submarine procurements.

PL830 - Production Engineering funds provide the following functions: value engineering; review and evaluation of production design data and documentation; production configuration control; maintenance engineering efforts designed and incorporated into the production manufacturing process, and other related engineering functions that are integral to all of the Imaging Systems and ancillary components.

PL900 - Imaging Systems engineering, technical and maintenance services funds provide the following functions: In-Service engineering and technical support to deployed Periscope and Imaging Equipment, imaging system installation and integration planning, SHIPALT and TEMPALT technical data preparation, production hardware design review, engineering/technical support for installations, training materials development, field engineering and technical problem resolution, block upgrade installation planning, configuration management, and maintenance planning including inventory, management, repair, and restoration scheduling.

PL927 - Funding is for the installation of Fleet Modernization Program Equipment.

PL4M7 - Funding is for the installation of non-Fleet Modernization Program Equipment.

(U) ELECTRONIC WARFARE: The Submarine Support Equipment Program (SSEP) was established to develop and support systems which provide the capability to exploit signal intercepts for tactical support and early warning of threat sensors. Capability Development Document (CDD) 907-97-16 dated 27 September 2016 directs PEOSUBS to provide a modern Electronic Warfare (EW) capability to LOS ANGELES, SEAWOLF, VIRGINIA and SSGN Class submarines. Funds procure AN/BLQ-10(V) Non-Recurring Engineering (NRE), new technology integration, and augmentation systems for EW Modernization upgrades for all submarine platforms. Funds also procure modification kits for the AN/ BLQ-10(V) EW System, Reliability & Maintainability, obsolescence and Operational Field Change Kits for the legacy AN/WLR-8(V)2 ESM system, and the legacy AN/BRD-7 direction finding system. Funds buy Fleet directed unique equipment in limited quantities that are maintained in a TEMPALT pool and rotated among attack submarines as dictated by scheduled operations and to provide specific capability improvements to major SSN sensor systems.

ML003 - SSEP special support equipment allows the procurement of special purpose test equipment utilized by the Type Commander Groom Teams. Exact quantities vary from year to year based on Fleet requirements.

ML007 - Procures the Improved Communications Acquisition and Direction Finding (ICADF) system below deck units for installation on LOS ANGELES, SEAWOLF and VIRGINIA Class submarines.

ML008 - Procures the ICADF Multi-Function Modular Mast (MMM) Antenna and subsystems for installation on LOS ANGELES and VIRGINIA Class submarines and advanced EW collection masts for future modernization.

ML010 - Procures Technical Insertions (TI) for installation on LOS ANGELES, SSGN, SEAWOLF, and VIRGINIA Class submarines that provide updates to the AN/BLQ-10(V) configuration baseline which incorporate current Commercial off the Shelf (COTS) processing technology and software to account for obsolescence avoidance, and Reliability, Maintainability and Availability (RMA), installation support and associated Integrated Logistics Support (ILS) and technical data. Hardware builds include supporting platform level Submarine Warfare Federated Tactical Systems (SWFTS) interfaces. TI upgrade kits are procured under various configurations in each fiscal year including required NRE for all future planned Technical Insertions in accordance with the SWFTS schedule. Funding also provides engineering for the capabilities inserted into the Advanced Processor Build (APB) process overseen by PEO Integrated Warfare Systems (IWS). The cost of digital upgrades for modernizations captured in ML020 is combined into the ML010 line starting in FY20. In FY21, all funding for digital upgrades in ML020 for future TIs is combined with ML010. This is being done in order to provide spiral improvements toward fully digital capabilities via the TI/APB process.

ML014 - FY19 continues legacy Submarine Electronic Surveillance Measures (SubESM) procurement including AN/BRD-7 and AN/WLR-8 Reliability and Maintainability (R&M) obsolescence and operational Field Change Kits and other materials for Obsolescence Mitigation, e.g., Digital Display Unit (DDU) obsolescence upgrade, Solid State Memory, Heat Dissipation improvement, related H,M&E sail components, Analog relay replacement, antenna cabling replacement, related Hull, Mechanical & Electrical (H,M&E) sail components and associated Integrated Logistics Support (ILS), and technical data.

ML015 - Procures the AN/BLQ-10(V)2/3/4 EW System for installation on LOS ANGELES, SEAWOLF, VIRGINIA and SSGN Class submarines.

ML017 - Procures AN/BLQ-10(V) and ICADF subsystem Product Improvement Field Change Kits including: emergent Engineering Changes, SIGINT carry-on equipment racks, SWFTS upgrades and associated Integrated Logistics Support (ILS) and technical data. Provides AN/BLQ-10 intermediate level repairs, changes and maintenance activities and associated materials that improve the overall Reliability, Maintainability and Availability of fielded EW systems. Procures sustainment efforts for AN/BLQ-10 active, deploying fleet assets. Provides funding for Submarine Launched Decoy Buoy to reduce risk of counter-detection for operating submarines. Provides funding for procurement of MMM Payload to support submarine Fleet required improved Unmanned Aerial System (UAS) communications/Tactical Data Link (TDL)/Electronic Attack (EA) capability.

ML018 - Funds procure EW Modernization upgrades to the VIRGINIA Class AN/BLQ-10(V)1 EW System including Photonics ES Product Improvement (PEPI-3), PATRIOT Phase B radar.

ML020: Funds procure AN/BLQ-10(V) Non-Recurring Engineering (NRE) and modernization kits for EW Modernization upgrades on all SSN/SSGN platforms. The AN/BLQ-10(V) efforts augment the current AN/BLQ-10(V) system for the rapid fielding of required capabilities to address changing and emerging threats in the Radio Frequency (RF) spectrum. In addition, each procurement aligns with hardware builds supporting platform level Submarine Warfare Federated Tactical Systems (SWFTS). The cost of digital upgrades for modernizations captured in ML020 is combined into the ML010 line starting in FY20. In FY21, all funding for digital upgrades in ML020 for future TIs is combined with ML010.

ML021 - Submarine RADAR funds provide BPS 15/16 Reliability, Maintainability and Availability (RMA), Field Change Kits and material procurements for obsolescence mitigation. Provides in-service and systems engineering, logistics, material, configuration management, quality assurance, installation and test certification support only for the Submarine Surface Navigation (AN/BPS-15/16) Radar. Provides for interface with the conjoined Voyage Management System (VMS) and Electronic Chart & Display Information System - Navy (ECDIS-N). Funding addresses sustainability of PATRIOT Phase B radar including repair/refurbishment, in-service engineering, and modernization. In addition, each procurement aligns with hardware builds supporting platform level Submarine Warfare Federated Tactical Systems (SWFTS).

ML830 - Production Engineering funds provide the following functions: value engineering; review and evaluation of production design data and documentation; production configuration control; maintenance engineering efforts designed and incorporated into the production manufacturing process, and other related engineering functions that are integral to all production EW Systems and upgrades.

ML927 - Provides for the Installation of Equipment including Fleet Modernization Program Installations for shipboard systems.

ML4M7 - Provides for the Installation of non-Fleet Modernization Program Equipment.

Justification.val:
IMAGING - FY 2019 procures TI-18 on (6) Los Angeles Class, (2) SSGN Class submarines, and (2) SSBN Class submarines.  Budget installs SWFTS modernizations on (3) VIRGINIA Class, (6) Los Angeles Class, and (1) SEAWOLF Class submarines. FY 2019 also reflects an increase of (2) LPPM  in order to meet PACFLT requirements for all deploying VIRGINIA Class submarines in the Pacific to be equipped with low profile imaging masts.

EW - FY 2019 procures TI-18 on (6) Los Angeles Class and (2) SSGN Class submarines. Unit costs are hull dependent and build on previous baselines to add both existing and future capabilities. FY 2019 installs SWFTS modernizations on (3) VIRGINIA Class, (6) Los Angeles Class, and (1) SEAWOLF Class submarines. FY 2019 also reflects an increase of (2) Multifunction Modular Mast (MMM) antenna improvement subsystems to increase reliability and reduce operational and maintenance costs for VIRGINIA modernizations and increases obligation to address obsolescence issues faced by the BPS RADAR system to ensure reliable safety of ship navigation and PATRIOT RADAR system to maintain tactical awareness in littoral operations

Name.@footnote: FY18 and out, PL900 requirements are consolidated under PL010.

Name.val: 2) ML014 Legacy Submarine Electronic Surveillance Measures (SubESM)

Name.@footnote: FY19 increases funding for BPS RADAR and PATRIOT RADAR wholeness which is required to improve the low operational availability of these systems and align with SWFTS modernization schedule. FY19 tasks include BPS RADAR SHIPALT/NRE/GFI package development for SSBN/SSN21/SSN774, Depot and In-Service Engineering Agent standup for both BPS RADAR and PATRIOT, ILS efforts to achieve PATRIOT material supportability by NAVSUP, procurement of (3) BPS RADAR modernization kits, support (13) BPS RADAR fleet installations, and obsolescence redesign for BPS RADAR.

TI/APB NRE funding levels are adjusted annually in response to the change in the quantity and the complexity of each new capability being incorporated into the inboard imaging software. FY19 NRE increase will fund significant required improvements to core ISIS system functionality (including cybersecurity protections). It would commence the system software and hardware expansion (as a result of prior research and TEMPALT) to support 360 degree video and integration with TOTIM. NRE is required to integrate the highly complex capabilities being incorporated within the Imaging system designed to increase operational effectiveness and improve situational awareness.

AIT:: Installation Name: VA TECHNICAL INSERTION (SWFTS)
AIT:: Installation Name: SSGN TECHNICAL INSERTION (SWFTS)
AIT:: Installation Name: VA ISIS BACKFIT (SWFTS)
AIT:: Installation Name: SSBN BACKFIT (SWFTS)

Description.val: Provides for the modernization of Imaging systems and Technical Insertion kits to upgrade Integrated Submarine Imaging System (ISIS) on LOS ANGELES, SEAWOLF, VIRGINIA and OHIO Class SSGN platforms in support of Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance (ISR) requirements.  VIRGINIA Tech Insertion unit costs reflect copper/fiber diploops and hull penetrators needed to field Low Profile Photonics Mast (LPPM) and the Task Oriented Tech Insertion Mast (TOTIM) on these modernization hulls as well as higher base unit cost of VIRGINIA Tech Insertions.  VIRGINIA Initial ISIS Backfits also contain copper/fiber updates for those hulls.  This line item aligns the periscope, imaging, and support equipment with the Submarine Warfare Federated Tactical System (SWFTS) interface with the Combat Control and Acoustic upgrades in budget line items 5420 and 2150.

Description.val: Provides obsolescence related upgrades for Submarine Periscopes. One (1) set is procured in each fiscal year that includes variable quantities.

Name.@footnote: Installations are funded by TYCOMs as necessary to meet operational requirements and are mission specific.

[none specified]:: Installation Name: TOTIM Capability Enhancement

Description.val:
VA Class advanced Low Profile Imaging masts including Low Profile Photonics Mast (LPPM) and Task Oriented Tech Insertion Mast (TOTIM). Procures initial modernization assets as well as spare masts later in FYDP to maintain overall spares ratio for imaging masts as quantity of imaging equipped ships increases. Maintaining sufficient quantities of installed and spare low profile imaging masts is essential to meet PACFLT requirements for all deploying VA class submarines in the Pacific to be equipped with low profile imaging masts. With development commencing in FY18 and procurement beginning in FY20, procurement of TOTIM will provide vastly increased capability, reduced maintenance costs and increased development flexibility for new mast sensors.

FY19 increase reflects procurement of (2) additional LPPM to meet tactical requirements for VIRGINIA Class deployments.

ImplementationMethodName.val: AIT (ES SYSTEM COMMS DF):: Installation Name: NIOC TRANSFER EQUIPMENT

Description.val: Provides advanced low-band COMINT Direction Finding (DF) capability compatible with CLASSIC TROLL and AN/BLQ-10 SSN EW system. Replaces obsolete AN/BRD-7 below decks equipment with modern, open architecture system compliant with Maritime Cryptologic Architecture.

Name.val: 1.1.2) Multi Functional Modular Mast - Organic - Organic

ImplementationMethodName.val: AIT:: Installation Name: Multi Functional Modular Mast
Multi Functional Modular Mast - Organic - Not Installed

Description.val:
Synchronizes improved low-band direction finding SIGINT sensor with coordinated N77/CNSG CLASSIC TROLL procurement. Replaces obsolete AN/BRD-7 antenna equipment and Improved ESM Mast (IEM) with modern, open-architecture system compliant with Maritime Cryptologic Architecture.

FY19 funding procures two (2) MMM antenna improvement subsystems for VIRGINIA modernizations to increase reliability and reduce operational and maintenance cost.

Name.@footnote: FY19 increases the Non-Recurring Engineering to support the greatly increased design, new technology integration, and software compatibility required to support future spectrum digitization processing. Growth in NRE in FY19 supports the initial award of the next AN/BLQ-10(V) contract which advances Next Generation Architecture towards a fully digital system through spiral improvements via the TI/APB process by updating existing capabilities to EW Server, Threat libraries, Radiant Valkyrie Lite capabilities and other government efforts that are required to be updated and integrated into the TI-20 system.

Unit costs are hull dependent and build on previous baselines to add both existing and future capabilities supported by higher costs.  As a result, there is an increase to the FY19 unit cost. The installation costs for 2 Kits procured as part of the PB17 Request for Additional Appropriations (RAA) is being maintained in the "To Complete" column of the Installation Information Table.

ImplementationMethodName.val: AIT:: Installation Name: TI-18 688I Class
AIT:: Installation Name: TI-18 SSGN CLASS
AIT:: Installation Name: TI-20 VA CLASS
AIT:: Installation Name: TI-22 688/21 Class

Description.val:
TI Processor upgrade provides additional computing capability over previous TI baselines and replaces out of production systems for installation on LOS ANGELES, SSGN, SEAWOLF, and VIRGINIA Class submarines. Provides updates to the AN/BLQ-10 (V) configuration baseline which incorporates current Commercial off the Shelf (COTS) processing technology and software to account for obsolescence avoidance, and Reliability, Maintainability and Availability (RMA) and associated Integrated Logistics Support (ILS) and technical data. Hardware builds include supporting platform level Submarine Warfare Federated Tactical Systems (SWFTS) interfaces.

Capability and Technical Insertion for AN/BLQ-10(V) provide spiral improvements to the baseline system which are designed to counter against new and evolving threat emitters. This effort is the transition of the EW AN/BLQ-10 TI modernization process to synchronize with SWFTS TI/APB process and model. The cost of digital upgrades for modernizations captured in ML020 is combined into the ML010 line starting in FY20. In FY21, all funding for digital upgrades in ML020 for future TIs is combined with ML010 following the completion of TI-18 upgrades.

The approximately $6M increase in ML010 NRE efforts in FY19 includes initial award of the next AN/BLQ-10 contract specific updates to support TI-20 system development and integration to EW Server, Threat libraries, Radiant Valkyrie Lite capabilities and other government efforts to improve and integrate with TI-20. These lines are being combined for the TI-20 procurement as they are both intended to buy a single AN/BLQ-10(V) upgrade. The TI-20 design, development, and integration contract is expected to award in FY19.

Name.@footnote: Installation of the last BLQ-10A system was originally planned for FY12 on SSN765 but ship modernization availability was postponed until FY17.

ImplementationMethodName.val: AIT:: Installation Name: AN/BLQ-10(V) SSN ES SYSTEM

Description.val: Provides fully integrated, covert, forward area radar signal intercept and ID capability for installation on LOS ANGELES, SEAWOLF, VIRGINIA and SSGN Class Submarines.

Name.@footnote: AN/BLQ-10 FCKs are procured in variable quantities and types, and are bought from a variety of vendors each fiscal year.  FY19 addresses need for EW Wholeness and adds funds for EW lifecycle sustainment support and increases operational availability.
Quantity reflects number of controllers with corresponding installs.  Number of buoys varies from year to year to meet inventory objective of 400 by FY22.
FY20 begins funding TDL communications, a program designed to increase submarine capability for joint operations.
Name.val: 1.1.4) Tactical Data Link (TDL) for Submarines - NonOrganic

ImplementationMethodName.val: AIT:: Installation Name: AN/BLQ-10(V) FCKs
AIT:: Installation Name: Submarine Launch Decoy (SLD)
AIT:: Installation Name: MMM Payloads
AIT:: Installation Name: Tactical Data Link (TDL) for Submarines

Description.val:
Procures AN/BLQ-10(V) and ICADF subsystem Product Improvement Field Change Kits (FCK). One (1) set of AN/BLQ-10 FCKs is procured in each fiscal tear that includes variable quantities and types, procured from a variety of vendors. Funding has been increased beginning in FY19 for EW Wholeness issues to address obsolescence and parts availability issues through FCKs.

Procures Submarine Launched Decoy (SLD) Buoy to reduce risk of counter-detection for operating submarines. The current funding profile for FY19 and FY20 allow the Navy to reach the inventory objective of 40 controllers and 400 buoys by FY22. FY23 continues procurement at a rate of 5 replacement controllers and 100 expendable buoys.

Procures MMM Payload Module antennas to support submarine Fleet required improved Unmanned Aerial System (UAS) communications/Tactical Data Link (TDL)/Electronic Warfare (EW) capability to meet emerging threats and provide new capabilities required by the Fleet.

Title.val: ML018 VA CLASS ES MODERNIZATION PATRIOT

Description.val: Procures EW Modernization upgrade of PATRIOT Phase B RADAR range finder for incorporation into the VIRGINIA CLASS Photonics Mast.

Name.@footnote: The installation costs for 2 Kits procured as part of the PB17 Request for Additional Appropriations (RAA) is being maintained in the "To Complete" column of the Installation Information Table.

ImplementationMethodName.val: AIT:: Installation Name: AN/BLQ-10(V) Backfit Kits

Description.val:
Procurement of AN/BLQ-10(V) NRE and modernization kits for EW Modernization upgrades for all submarine platforms. The rapid proliferation of complex radar, communications and navigation equipment available to potential adversaries creates a need for sustained and significant improvements to submarine systems in order to maintain tactical ship safety and operational effectiveness. Commander Submarine Forces and the Submarine Tactical Requirements Group (STRG) raised EW primary mission area in FY12 to be the number one modernization requirement.

The cost of digital upgrades for modernizations captured in ML020 is combined into the ML010 line starting in FY20. In FY21, all funding for digital upgrades in ML020 for future TIs is combined with ML010.
